title: Experiential Marketing Education Based on Virtual Worlds: Enhancing Language and Marketing Practical Skills Through Reflective Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational marketing theory, digital marketing experience, business text interpretation and writing skills (grammar, vocabulary, rhetoric), and basic understanding of diverse communication channels
context.additional_context: One digital device (tablet/laptop) per learner, with a blended offline-online classroom environment using virtual world platforms (e.g., Gather.town). The practice-oriented curriculum includes training in crafting marketing messages and target-specific linguistic expressions. Feedback sessions are conducted in parallel to enhance learners' reading comprehension, writing, and expressive skills.

learning_goals: Learners can plan and execute text and video content for marketing campaigns on a virtual platform, complete experiential learning processes at over 90%, and apply vocabulary selection and expression strategies tailored to target audiences.

Learners can analyze at least three strengths and weaknesses of linguistic expressions (metaphors, tone, style) and audience-specific communication (age/gender/cultural differences) in virtual world marketing through reflective practice journaling.

Learners can establish virtual marketing strategies applicable to real business cases (e.g., B2B/B2C product launches) based on team project outcomes, create presentation materials including message frameworks (keywords, sentence structures, emotional appeal elements) for at least three target audiences, deliver a 15-minute presentation, and achieve over 80 points on an evaluation rubric (strategy validity 30%, message specificity 30%, feasibility 40%).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
